MANISH BHASIN ON THE CRICKET WORLD CUP FINAL
 Australia take on Sri Lanka in the Cricket World Cup final in Barbados on Saturday and the Aussies look unstoppable. 


They've won every game comprehensively, they've been so clinical it's almost frightening, and the only crack in their armour would appear to be complacency. 


They've yet to lose more than six wickets in a game so far and are unbeaten in their past 28 World Cup games, but after such a great run the law of averages says they are due to come unstuck at some stage.


The multi-talented Sri Lankans possess arguably the best bowling attack of the tournament and may have pulled off a masterstroke by not playing their three best bowlers against Australia in the Super Eight stage. 


At the time I thought they had let themselves down slightly by not playing Chaminda Vaas, Muttiah Muralitharan and Lasith Malinga, but it could have a bearing on the outcome. 


In Malinga they have one of the stars of the World Cup. 


Unbelievably the paceman has never faced Australia in a one-day international and has not played them in a Test since 2004. 


This could work hugely in Sri Lanka's favour as he has come on leaps and bounds since then and is such a devastating bowler because of his unique style of delivery. 


There is no doubt that some aspects of the World Cup have been disappointing, and the ICC must bear some responsibility for that. 


By stopping musical instruments being brought into grounds and charging exorbitant ticket prices, the much-anticipated local Caribbean flavour has been lost. 


The tournament has also had to cope with the shocking death of Pakistan coach Bob Woolmer. 


Everyone was talking about this being a carnival of cricket - let's hope the final can be just that. 


Enjoy the game, 


Manish 


Manish will present highlights of the Cricket World Cup final on Saturday from 2350 BST on BBC ONE.
